pageSubtitle: Enter allowed hosts and HTTP verbs. You can enter * for all hosts. Use the * option for development to enable application code running locally on your computer to communicate directly with your DreamFactory instance.

tooltips.path: Specify the API path pattern this CORS rule applies to. Use wildcards (*) for broader matching.
tooltips.description: Optional description to help identify this CORS configuration rule.
tooltips.origins: List of allowed origins. Use * to allow all origins (not recommended for production).
tooltips.headers: HTTP headers that are allowed in preflight requests.
tooltips.exposedHeaders: Headers that browsers are allowed to access in the response.
tooltips.maxAge: How long browsers can cache preflight response (in seconds).
tooltips.methods: HTTP methods allowed for cross-origin requests.
tooltips.supportsCredentials: Whether credentials (cookies, authorization headers) are allowed.
tooltips.enabled: Enable or disable this CORS rule.

help.whatIsCors: CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) allows web applications from different domains to access your API.
help.securityNote: Be careful with wildcard (*) origins in production environments as they can pose security risks.
help.testingTip: Use the test configuration feature to verify your CORS settings work with your client applications.
